headline: 322,000 Nigerian refugees in Niger, Cameroon, Chad – FG
summarized_story:
A total of 322,000 Nigerian refugees are currently in the Republics of Niger, Cameroon and Chad, the Federal Government said on Friday.
The Minister of Humanitarian Affairs, Disaster Management and Social Development, Sadiya Farouq, disclosed this while receiving the draft report from the Technical Working Group on the repatriation of Nigerian refugees in Cameroon.
The TWG presented the draft tripartite agreement for the voluntary repatriation of Nigerian refugees in Niger Republic and Chad to the minister in Abuja.
The statement read in part, “Receiving the draft at the Nigerian Army Resource Centre Abuja, Farouq noted that a total of 322,000 Nigerian refugees were currently living in neighbouring countries.
“Out of the figures, Niger currently hosts 186,957 refugees, the Republic of Cameroon 118,409 refugees, while 16,634 refugees are in the Republic of Chad.”The statement quoted Farouq as saying “With the large number of refugees in Niger, Chad and Cameroon, the Federal Government has officially initiated talks with the governments of Chad and Niger to sign tripartite agreements similar to the one we have with the Republic of Cameroon.

headline: COVID-19: Ekiti begins second phase of vaccination, cautions residents
summarized_story:
The Ekiti State Government on Friday said it had begun the second phase of vaccination across the 16 council areas.
The Commissioner for Health, Dr Oyebanji Filani, who disclosed this, said the commencement followed the arrival of Moderna COVID-19 vaccines in the state.
Meanwhile, experts in the health sector have called on the Federal Government to approach the Chinese government on vaccines production and distribution, to bring more choices of safe vaccines for Nigerians.
The engagement also stressed the need for local production of COVID-19 vaccines in partnership with the Chinese government to halt the spread of the virus in the country.
The meeting, according to Oni, also deliberated on a number of issues including the need to ensure fair and equitable distribution of COVID-19 vaccines, tapping into Chinese Belt and Road Initiatives amidst COVID-19.

headline: Petroleum marketers in Imo suspend strike
summarized_story:
The Independent Petroleum Marketers Association of Nigeria, IPMAN, in Imo State on Friday suspended its strike.
The suspension of the strike was contained in a release issued in Owerri, the state capital, after a series of meetings had been held involving the Imo State Government , Department of Petroleum Resources (DPR), Department of State Services (DSS), Petroleum Tankers Drivers (PTD) branch of the Nigeria Union of Petroleum and Natural Gas Workers (NUPENG) branch of the Association of Imo Petroleum Marketers and Dealers and some security agencies in the state.
The release, which was signed on behalf of the Association of Imo Petroleum Marketers and Dealers by Sir Chimodo Martin reads: “It is no longer news that Association of Imo Petroleum Marketers and Dealers embarked on industrial action since Wednesday, 25th August, 2021.
“The Association has made its sufferings in the hands of some Government agencies known to the public through the industrial action.
“Relying on the above promise, the government and the intervention of the DSS, Imo Petroleum Marketers and Dealers have suspended the industrial action forthwith.

headline: Panic over pipeline leakage in Lagos
summarized_story:
By Chika AbanobiResidents living around Omoboriowo Street, Pipeline, Bus Stop, located on Igando-Ikotun Road, panicked yesterday morning, took their heels and ran helter-skelter, following pipeline leakage that saw very large volume of premium motor spirit, otherwise known as petrol, gushing out from the big pipe.
Residents who spoke to journalists claim to have started noticing the leakage from the pipeline belonging to the Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation (NNPC) at about 6am yesterday.
But following calls placed by some of the anxious but enlightened residents to concerned authorities helps were immediately sent to the area from Lagos State Emergency Management Agency (LASEMA), LRU (Light Rescue Unit) Fire, Lagos State Fire Service, Nigerian Security and Civil Defence Corps (NSCDC), NNPC, Lagos State Transport Management and Administration (LASTMA) and Lagos Neighbourhood Safety Corps (LNSC).
Speaking on the development, Dr. Olufemi Oke-Osanyintolu, Director-General, Lagos State Emergency Management Agency (LASEMA), linked the leakage to petroleum vandals.
“A very large volume of PMS was gushing out of the NNPC pipeline,” he said.

headline: Detention: Igboho’s Associates Threaten Contempt Proceedings against DSS DG

Apparently angered by the development, the lawyer to the 12 detained associates, Mr Pelumi Olajengbesi, on Friday, threatened to commence contempt proceedings against Bichi for the agency’s alleged failure to comply with an order of court for the release of his clients.

headline: Three US residents indicted over 'illegal exportation of arms to Nigeria'
summarized_story:
Three residents of Maryland, USA, have been indicted over allegations of exporting arms and ammunition to Nigeria.
The suspects — listed as 45-year-old Wilson Nuyila Tita of Owings Mills, Maryland; 40-year-old Eric Fru Nji of Fort Washington, Maryland; andWilson Che Fonguh of Bowie, Maryland, aged 39 — are alleged to have exported arms and ammunition to Nigeria illegally.
“A federal grand jury has returned an indictment charging three Maryland men for the federal charges of conspiracy, violation of the Arms Export Control Act and the Export Reform Control Act, related to the export of firearms and ammunition from the United States to Nigeria,” the statement reads.
“The defendants also allegedly conspired to conceal from the United States that those items were being shipped from the Port of Baltimore in Maryland to Nigeria and at least one other location in Africa.
The defendants and their co-conspirators allegedly contributed funds for the purchase of firearms, ammunition, reloading materials and other equipment for shipping overseas.

headline: MaxAB extends Series A to $55M, largest ever by an Egyptian startup
summarized_story:
MaxAB, an Egyptian eCommerce platform that serves food and grocery retailers, has raised an additional $15M from existing investors bringing its total Series A funding to $55M, the largest ever by an Egyptian startup.
In addition, it announced its acquisition of WaystoCap, a Morocco-based e-commerce and distribution platform that connects retailers with suppliers across Africa.
Two years later, the company got into the 2017 Y Combinator’s Winter batch, making it the first company accepted from Morocco.
WaystoCap expanded its cross-border services to Ivory Coast and Togo, and at some point, was processing over $3 million worth of transactions per quarter.
The acquisition will see MaxAB accelerate its expansion into the Maghreb market – Algeria, Libya, Mauritania, Morocco and Tunisia – empowered by WaystoCap’s expertise in the region.

summarized_story:
Share FacebookTwitterStumbleuponLinkedInPinterestBENIN CITY – The Edo State Government has alerted residents to the activities of fraudsters circulating fake entrance forms into the Edo State College of Nursing Sciences.
In a statement, Secretary to the Edo State Government, Osarodion Ogie Esq., disclosed that the government has not commenced the sale of entrance/admission forms into the college, noting that sale of such forms will be duly publicized through the appropriate channels.
The statement reads: “It has come to the attention of the Edo State Government that some persons, in a bid to defraud unsuspecting members of the public, have resorted to putting on sale fake entrance forms into the Edo State College of Nursing Sciences.
“Government therefore wishes to put all interested candidates, as well as the general public on notice, that the Edo State College of Nursing Sciences has not commenced sales of Entrance/Admission Forms.
“For the avoidance of doubt, sale of entrance/admission forms into the College will be duly publicized through the appropriate channels, namely the official website of the Edo State Government on https://www.edostate.gov.ng and the Print and Electronic Media on commencement of the process.”“Government hereby reiterates the need to avoid dealing with any person purportedly acting as an agent to the Ministry of Health or the College of Nursing Sciences in respect of the sale of entrance/admission forms into the College,” Ogie noted.

headline: Zenith Bank proposes N9.42bn interim dividend for half year 2021
summarized_story:

The assurances by the senior officers to rid the northwest zone of banditry is coming a few days after the Zamfara state Governor Bello Matawalle called on president Muhammadu Buhari to declare a state of emergency on security in Northern Nigeria.

headline: 32 More Bethel Baptist College Students Regain Freedom
summarized_story:
Thirty-two more students abducted from Bethel Baptist College in Kaduna state have regained their freedom.
Details about their release are still sketchy, but sources say the students have been handed over to their parents.
The Kaduna state government and police authorities in the state are yet to comment on this development.
AdvertisementThe students are part of 121 students who were abducted form the Bethel Baptist College in the Maraban area of Kaduna metropolis 5th July.
The latest development brings the number of students who have regained their freedom after the July incident to ninety.

headline: Oil Marketers call off 3-Day old Strike in Imo
summarized_story:
The Association of Oil Marketers in Imo State has suspended it’s three day old strike following Intervention of stakeholders in the State.
The Association however gave the state government two weeks to resolve all lingering issues raised by association.

headline: Nigeria: Bandits Release 32 Bethel Baptist Students in Kaduna after Ransom Paid, 31 Still Held Captive
summarized_story:
Thirty-two of the remaining sixty-three abducted students of Bethel Baptist High school, Damishi, in Nigeria’s northern Kaduna state have been released from captivity.
The chairman of the Christian Association of Nigeria, Kaduna state chapter, Joseph Hayab confirmed this to ARISE News.
He said the students were released Friday evening and have reunited with their parents.
An undisclosed sum of money was paid before their release.
The remaining students still In captivity are now thirty-one.

headline: UK Donates Additional 592,880 Covid Vaccine Doses to Nigeria
summarized_story:
The United Kingdom (UK) has donated another 592,880 COVID-19 vaccine doses to Nigeria, bringing the total to 1,292,640 doses given to the African country by the European country in August alone.
The UK has pledged to share 80 million doses of COVID-19 vaccines with the COVAX Facility, as part of a broader pledge to share 100 million doses with the rest of the world.
The statement read: “Today (Friday), Nigeria received another 592,880 doses of the AstraZeneca-Oxford COVID-19 vaccine donated to Nigeria by the UK via the COVAX Facility.
This brings the total number of COVID-19 vaccine doses donated to Nigeria from the UK through COVAX to 1,292,640 doses in August alone.
I am so pleased to see Nigeria receive an extra 592,880 doses donated by the UK, which brings the total this month to 1,292,640 doses.

headline: Galaxy Z Fold 3 and Z Flip 3: Samsung’s Revolutionary Foldable Phones
summarized_story:
Samsung Electronics has opened the next chapter in foldable innovation with Galaxy Z Series, which Samsung users have come to love and cherish.
Stephen Okwara, a software engineer and tech trainer, is Key Account Manager at Samsung West Africa.
He joined the Morning Show on Friday to speak about the Samsung Galaxy Z Fold3 and Z Flip3.
Both give users unique new ways to work, watch, and play.
As proud pioneers of the foldable smartphone category, the company has vowed to continue building on the legacy of innovation to shape the future of mobile phone industry globally.

headline: Man United in Advanced Talks to Sign Juventus Forward Cristiano Ronaldo
summarized_story:
Manchester United are in advanced talks to sign Portugal captain Cristiano Ronaldo from Juventus.
United boss Ole Gunnar Solskjaer said Ronaldo “knows that we are here” during a press conference on Friday.
Ronaldo signed for Manchester United from Sporting Lisbon for £12.2m in 2003 and scored 118 goals in 292 appearances for the club.
“I didn’t think Cristiano was going to turn out leaving Juventus,” Solskjaer said.
Speaking before City face Arsenal in the Premier League on Saturday, manager Pep Guardiola said: “Cristiano is a Juventus player.

headline: Nigeria: Following Court Judgement, Secondus Returns as PDP National Chairman
summarized_story:
Uche Secondus on Friday took over as the National chairman of the Peoples Democratic Party, PDP.
The embattled National Chairman had obeyed an experte order of a Rivers State High Court that sacked him, but got reinstated after a Kebbi State High Court presided over by Justice Nasirat.i.
Media adviser to Mr Secondus, Ike Abonyi in a statement said the Deputy National Chairman South, Yemi Akinwomi who held forth in his absence upon receipt of the Court order handed over the affairs of the party him.
The statement read in part, “at the brief handover, Prince Secondus pledged to continue providing astute leadership to the party.
“Elder Akinwomi also announced his receipt of the court order which he presented to the caucus meeting.”By Abel Ejikeme
